intro: Anisotoma natalensis, commonly known as Natal anisotome, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Anisotoma natalensis is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
